network.bdy:
Organizational network analysis is a method for studying communication1 and socio-technical networks within a formal organization. It is a quantitative descriptive technique for creating statistical and graphical models of the people, tasks, groups, knowledge and resources of organizational systems. It is based on social network theory2 and more specifically, dynamic network analysis.
Many tools exist to assist with both data capture (e.g. onasurveys.com http://www.onasurveys.com) and visualisation (e.g. Netdraw http://www.analytictech.com/downloadnd.htm).
